Wine tasting room not really a big deal that it is in a cave (a "fake" cave--for a real cave tasting experience go to Deerfield Family Ranch in Sonoma). Room smelled moldy. No real upscale amenitites--had to call to get a shower cap. Restaurant was very good for dinner and VERY understaffed for the Sunday brunch. Liked the dinner better than Cuvee in town. Front desk staff was nice and accomodating. Free coffee and water was nice in the morning but we get that on business trips with pretty much any hotel now. Setting is pretty even though the complex is in a business park. Major plus is that it is really close if you are driving from the Sacramento area and easy access to wineries. If had to do it over again would be just as happy at Embassy Suites in downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to unwind after Wine Tasting all Day”
Reviews.Author: gordi00728
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel while on vacation over labor day in 2010. They used their travel reward points too book 2 rooms that were adjoined where one had a kitchen. I really enjoyed this as we had a living room to relax in and watch TV. Also we had an ample sized kitchen where we made quick bites to eat. There was plenty of space in both rooms. The hotel has a spa but we did not have time for it. Very gorgeous scennery around this hotel and well decorated. The pool was really nice to get into because it is hot in Napa during Labor day. The nice SF weather does not stretch that far. But at night it got cool and we went to the hottub which was nice as well. Overall a good place to stay at the start of Napa a bit off the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not a "destination" hotel”
Reviews.Author: srlndstrm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on a recent drive down the West Coast. This is a nice hotel that is clean and feels new. It is decorated in a rustic Mediterranean feel. Our room was huge with a large bed and included a complimentary bottle of wine. There was a lovely pool area with a firepit (but the fire was out before 10pm, kind of a bummer). The people at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little bit out of the main Napa town area, so there isn't a ton in the area for a leisure/vacation traveler. However, this does seem like a really good hotel to hold a conference at. I'm not sure I'd come here as a "destination" though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: enjoylifenow14
Reviews.Content: We spent our anniversary at the resort and absolutely loved the entire weekend. The Meritage is very well appointed and the staff is very attentive. They go out of their way to make you feel welcomed and part of the family. The Friday night complimentary wine tasting and appetizers was a very nice touch to start the weekend off. We had dinner reservations downtown and the shuttle was the best way to travel. Pickup and delivery were easy as could be and very prompt.

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel and so so experience.”
Reviews.Author: tchrtravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the weekend of the 4th of July to celebrate my sister's 40th birthday and my 21st anniversary. It was an okay experience. Let me say that we were first given a room that made my husband and me both laugh: it was comfortable, beautiful, and DARK. When we tried to look out the window we looked out on a small space about one foot by one foot. We did ask for a change and were granted a room overlooking construction. Not bad. The room itself was nice: a bottle of drinkable red wine, a nice setup, and a very comfortable bed. Unfortunately, when I informed the desk that we were indeed there to celebrate they neglected to put our "celebration" onto their list that they post every morning of celebrations. Neither of our celebrations was listed. So, basically, it's a comfortable hotel without outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to visit for pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: SFTreeHouse
Reviews.Content: Meritage was a total surprise when I arrived for a recent business trip to Napa. The property is all-inclusive with bar, restaurant, unique spa and event space in a cave under their vineyards, hiking throug the vineyards, wine-tasting, pool, etc. etc. It is beautiful and beautifully laid out. And, the staff had the best 'can do' attitude I've ever experienced. No need to leave the property but, if you feel you must, they provide shuttle service into the town of Napa (4 miles) from 5:30 - 10 daily. Perfect for enjoying a wine-paired dinner at one of Napa's destination restaurants - Ubuntu, Morimoto, Fish Story, etc. without worrying about driving. They've thought of everything - this is truly relaxation vacationing at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: kerenjh01
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The rooms were a good size and looked clean. They have the best smelling rooms. The amenities were also good. They have a DVD library and they give you popcorn for free. Overall good experience. No complaints. Oh and there's a bottle of wine in the room and they give you two water bottles per day, no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful inside, surroundings less wonderful”
Reviews.Author: famousfamos
Reviews.Content: Resort is located in an office park and not quite the rolling hill views we expected. Hover, the hotel itself is beautiful and luxurious. Was disappointed the "concierge" tried to get us on a timeshare tour but avoided that desk for the rest of our stay...

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Delight”
Reviews.Author: purplemartinhh
Reviews.Content: As guests of Beringer we spent three delightful days in Napa Valley, including a private performance by Michael Buble on the lawn of the Beringer estate. Accommodations at the Meritage were first class. The ambiance -- surrounded by & overlooking vineyards which you can walk thru -- could not have been more appropriate. The staff is very friendly and go out of their way to please. Rooms are nicely appointed and we loved the double sinks in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “i think i'll try some merlot before my spa massage...”
Reviews.Author: odarek
Reviews.Content: a remarkable resort to destress at and enjoy. our first visit became my wife's birthday enchantment week. brandon, a very knowedgeable pool bartender, gave us hints to take advantage of while in napa. wine tasting, chinese food, the spa!, did i say wine tasting?, calistoga(massage and shop-ping, meritage deep tissue massage!, and oh yeah, wine tasting. nichole deserves mention regarding massage. matthew highlights the front desk action. a very wonderful, rich, and relaxing week to celebrate life and my lady.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place,special spa!”
Reviews.Author: purereality
Reviews.Content: it was a beautiful resort with alot to offer which made up for its location which was a liitle south of the town of napa...the rooms were well appointed and comfortable and a nice staff, Evan at the front desk was super helpful. We were here for my wifes birthday and so part of her gift was a day oi pampering in their spa which was built in a natural cave setting( very natural we loved it)They treated us very special and accomadated as if we had been there a million times, so a special thanks to Raul for making her day so special.. The one opportunity for improvement would have been in the restaurant,no style or energy...so i would reccomend eating in some of the great places that napa has to offerf

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Born2BFun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights for a romantic getaway in Napa. This was our first trip to Napa and we are eager to return. I doubt we would stay anywhere else as our stay at The Meritage was fantastic! The rooms were smaller, but the bed was comfortable, the bathrooms were large with a beautiful walk in shower. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the pool and vineyard from our room, which was an added bonus. The pool was at perfect temperature, clean and peaceful. Never made it to the spa or the wine tasting in the cave (doing both next time!) The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, catering to our every request. They extended their knowledge of the region with pride and sent us to some of our most memorable dining and wine tasting experiences. I would give this hotel a 5 star rating, however as I said earlier the rooms were a bit smaller and the location is off the beaten path. But otherwise, it's beautiful and relaxing and we can't wait to go back. (However next time, we'll be upgrading to have a balcony!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: 5starll50
Reviews.Content: A nice room and pretty lobby does not a resort make. My stay was disappointing in that the description was much more grandiose than the reality of the property. "Family condo summer vacation" was the focus of the property. Isolated from amenities and less than warm experience at reception and the wine tasting hour filled me with regret over my choice of this "hotel". The push to attend a presentation on membership when we arrived was telling of the atmosphere. We dined in the Sienna restaurant with a mere 3 other tables occupied. Fortunately, the service and food were good. The room was nice but small and the balcony view was limited and overrated. I would not recommend nor return for vacation. It is overpriced as well.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely phenomenal hotel--can't wait to go again!”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2travel4me
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds! Wine tasting in the caves is a must... Incredible experience! The room and the service exceeded my expectations, and I frequent Napa often. Don't forget to try one of their many spa treatments, so relaxing! All in all, I'd say this is the perfect hotel with superb service.

Reviews.Title: “Double Queen Construction Zone”
Reviews.Author: SOCALS
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was less than expected. Booked one night since we already had a reservation for the weekend at a B&B in downtown Napa for the weekend. Business finished early in San Francisco and needed a place close to Napa for one night since the B&B could not accommodate us for that evening. We booked through Hotwire for a fair price (after the taxes and resort fee are added). Upon arrival, Jonathan at the front desk informed us we were being upgraded to a deluxe room with patio. I asked about the huge construction project going on next door and was informed they don't commence work until 9 AM. When we arrived at the room, we realized were assigned a double queen with a balcony overlooking the full construction project (now wondering what we would have had if we were not upgraded). A couple minutes after our arrival at the room, Jonathan at the front desk called and asked what we thought of the room. I informed him that I thought we would be assigned a king bed as I am 6' 6" and a queen would not work for my wife and I. After being on hold for a couple minutes, he stated they were out of king rooms and reiterated that construction does not begin until 9. Jonathan informed us the concierge had a gift for us. Upon arrival at the desk, the concierge presented a 2 for 1 coupon to wineries I had no intention of tasting, and proceeded to pitch a time share presentation for the next day. Really? After the room your property just put me in, you think I am even remotely interested in more of this scenario here and other properties associated with the investment company. No problems during the evening and the bar was busy with several parties including a bridal shower. Decided to partake in the hot tub which was a good size for the property. In the morning, after sleeping in separate queen beds, seems the construction crew did not get the memo. About 7:45 AM, the crews began preparing their equipment, cranes, bulldozers and power tools. At 8:00 AM, full scale construction was in motion. We used this as our property wake-up call, proceeded to pack our bags and depart the property. On the way out the front door, turned in the keys to Cinnamon and she very politely asked how our stay was. I explained what transpired and told her when we come back to Napa, we will seek shelter elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Grapedragon
Reviews.Content: I did not stay here I attended a banquet at Meritage. Over the years I have stayed at and attended banquets at all types and qualities of hotels all over the world, this experience had to be the best. I had the opportunity to experience the staff from the front entry, front desk, lobby and banquet room. With out exception every member of the staff seemed genuinely concerned that I had my needs met and that they provided me with a great experience. I was so impressed that I asked for the General Manager so I could tell him. You will not be disappointed if you stay here or just use their facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JimAVMS
Reviews.Content: I just loved this place. Rooms were great and affordable, Monica the bartender was great. The pool was incredible with cocktail serivice and music playing and the spa was to die for. I will be back for Sure. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: MST5110
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is very beautiful. You feel like you could be in Tuscany. However, the location is a little strange (in a business area). I also did not like being asked if "I would love to come back" or "want to win a trip to Hawaii" which is a ploy to get you to a timeshare meeting. If you pay that much for a hotel... they shouldn't be bothering you as you walk in and out. I also did not understand the resort fee. What was it for? No daily newspaper, no wi-fi, so Im still trying to figure that one out. The restaurant on the resort was average. So if you want a beautiful hotel and close to everything (about 10 minute drive) this is a good resort, but watch out for the hidden fees and time share sharks.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Paul60750
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff, food was excellent, spa and wine tasting as good as any in Napa if not the best, service first class. The whole "package" is so excellent we will return, and soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and great location!”
Reviews.Author: 4Family4
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Memorial Weekend and it was a great place to unwind. This was our second stay (first was 5 years ago), so we weren't surprised by its location in a tech park. Even though it may not be as scenic, the location is actually very convenient to both highways that run parallel through wine country (29 and Silverado Trail), so you can avoid the congestion of the 29! The hotel is lovely and the service is great. They're building a new addition, but there weren't any workers at the time of our stay since it was a holiday weekend. I'm not sure whether noise is a concern during normal construction hours.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: binnzer
Reviews.Content: I live about 30 minutes from Napa, but decided to have a weekend girls trip. I have been to the Meritge many times for events, but this was the first time I've actually stayed there. The location is good, it's about 2.5 miles outside of the Downtown Napa area. It is a 30-40 minute drive to various Wineries. It's very quite, staff is friendly. There is no continental breakfast if that's something your worried about, just coffee. There is a restaurant, but it is on the higher end. We stayed in a "Suite" with 2 queen beds, but there was nothing "suite" about it. Just a regular room with 2 queen beds. Nice pool and spa area. Would stay there again. Free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a getaway with the girls”
Reviews.Author: NYNYGirlie
Reviews.Content: Three of us booked a room at the Meritage and were very happy with our stay. The complimentary bottle of wine and bottles of water in the room were very nice. We were able to have a wine tour pick us up and drop us off at the front door and the bellman took our wine purchases to our room. We used the complimentary shuttle to our restaurant reservations in downtown Napa and had great service both ways. We had spa packages for the next day and loved the grotto surroundings. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. The front desk assisted me in shipping my wine purchases across country and they arrived on time and intact. This was a hidden gem but unfortunately the weather did not cooperate with us using the outside pool. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, low-key service”
Reviews.Author: curmudgeon99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Meritage recently for a business meeting, and was very satisfied. The service and facilities were top-notch, resolving requests without any fuss or hassle. I thought the staff were some of the best I've seen, not getting in the way when we wanted to do things ourselves, but at hand and effective for any services we needed. Rooms and facilities were typical luxury hotel. There's a vinyard on the hillside behind the hotel that you can walk around, but otherwise nothing of interest in walking distance. While everything was done well at the hotel, at the same time, it didn't have anything (like great views or walkable location) that really drew me to want to make a priority to come back on a personal trip. I didn't try any of the spa services; those might make more of a draw for some people.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: swibee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meritage Resort and Spa for two nights at the beginning of our vacation. We found the location a little strange. The hotel is located in some sort of a business park off the highway. Our room was nice, the bed comfortable, the view... in some sort of a backyard and staff access. There's nothing really great and nothing bad I can say about the place. Most probably there are nicer places to stay in and around Napa but it served our need for a two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun4000
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward for this trip!!! We save some money, scheduled a baby siter to watch the kids and fly to SF, drove to Napa al cheer up. Well, this hotel is nothing but a little hotel. Why $300/night, I don't get it. We din't get what promised and were very upset. The cave Spa which is promoted in every brochure and in the hotel's name "The Meritage Resourt and Spa" is a falls information. The spa we were told by Piter from the front desk is a SEPERATE BUSINESS!!! as a guest of the hotel we could not get an appointment nor come and join the facility, such as the steam room or Jacquzi. We were told by the Spa Host that we could not come on the weekend because its booked by out side guest...and there were NO ONE in the SPA. Michael, the manager said the sam thing, the Spa is a seperate business and not part of the hotel!!! The councier keep calling our room looking for us to give us a "welcome gift"...it ends up she was trying to have up come to a 3 hour meeting to buy a time share...6:30 am Monday morning we heard this horrobile sound, looking at the window, we saw the mini people blowing pestasice all over the vines across the hotel. Well people, save your money and go to another hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: NHJoan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weeks vacation in Napa and San Francisco. During our stay in Napa we stayed at The Meritage Resort and Spa. We arrived at the hotel were immediately upgraded to a "room with a view" and a bottle of wine. Our room was spacious - two double beds with a flat screen TV. They also offer complementary DVD's and a bag of popcorn to go with it. Our room was spotless and the bathroom worked well with double sinks and a separate area for the toilet. The hotel offers a complementary shuttle which we used nightly to take us to either a restaurant or to the Napa Wine Train. They have their own vineyard with a beautiful spa and wine cave we enjoyed a complementary tasting during our stay. I have to say that the staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. We had a wonderful stay and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: sctiger
Reviews.Content: Joined a couple friends and wife in napa for 2 nights and made the mistake of staying here. The pros: Nice staff, and to our surprise offered a free shuttle service! Cons: LOCATION!! You are 5-7 minutes out from downtown Napa, but drive through car dealers, home depots etc...to get anywhere. Just really was nothing special at all to the place, you feel like their goal was to be as large a resort as possible, and was nothing more than a glorified Holiday INN.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Management needs to Improve”
Reviews.Author: MJRLdal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meritage May 12 to May 15th. It appears the Hotel is lacking in overall management and Customer Focus. Here are examples of why I say this. On the first night went to the lobby bar to have a drink, waited over 20 minutes without even an acknowledgement of the bartender. And the bar only had about 5 customers in it. We left and drove into Napa to get batter service. Spent over $ 400.00 at the Spa, the attendants in the dressing rooms were great, however no hot water in the showers and only comment form front desk we are working on it and we will take a little off you bill, still have not seen that. Went to the restaurant for breakfast, waited 10 minutes to be seated, again very few people eating at tables most of the tables were empty but still had dirty dishes on them. After being seated took 15 minutes to get have our order taken, then another 30 minutes for the food. This was a simple breakfast not full meals. Service very slow and not customer focused. We decided to go to the wine tasting room. All over the hotel were notes (even on the room key) go to wine tasting 2 for 1 if you are staying at the hotel. The next day I noticed out invoice and they changed us for two wine tastings. I went to the front desk to ask about this and the front desk said…” I can print your invoice and you can walk over there and ask them why they charged your wrong”, once again lack of customer focus. In the three days we were there we spent $ 1,600.00 for the room and Spa, defiantly not worth it. I would recommend staying at one of the hotels in downtown Napa and not out in the business park.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jbelne
Reviews.Content: The web site looked amazing but don't be fooled. Firstly this hotel is in a business park. Secondly the service is dreadful. Especially at breakfast, 45 minutes after arrival we were yet to get so much as a glass of water. We had to repeatedly ask for our juices and hot drinks, it wasn't until we got angry that anyone bothered to do anything. Monica in the bar did a great job but was constantly left alone, so despite her greatest efforts service was slow. My room had some giant pice of plastic outside which flapped and smacked against the wall all night. The spa is not included, and the outdoor pool wasn't sufficiently heated. On a positive note, thanks to Rosemary the concierge for arranging a great wine tasting schedule and recommending the fabulous Morimoto Napa, the best Japanese restraurant I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “their right hand doesnt know what their left hand is doing”
Reviews.Author: birthdayfiasco
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness for some amazing employees such as Jen and Raul or else this review would be 100% negative. we had some confusion with a gift package given to us a few years ago. we booked it and I was very clear during my booking as to what it entailed. I even faxed the list of what it included and gave them weeks to confirm it all. From the bewildered front desk to the initial spa attendant, everyone doubted and questioned what I was saying. what happened to "the customer is always right". they need ritz carlton training is all I can say. if it werent for some people, like Jen who made things "right"...we almost checked out as soon as we checked in. what was a bday celebration caused me much stress.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Lizibeth19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls weekend. Horrible customer service. Discouraged from calling a cab in favor of a shuttle by concierge. Told to wait in bar and ultimately was passed up times two in fifteen minutes. Then told could either take a shuttle in another 30 minutes or pay for a cab that would arrive in 30 minutes. No attempt to rectify situation by concierge. Overall not upset about the money but very upset by how things were handled and disregard for effort and time. You would be better served at a bed and breakfast or a place closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies weekend in Napa made perfect!”
Reviews.Author: nikkirenison
Reviews.Content: Arrived earily so we were not able to check in for several hours, the bell desk collected our things and even refrigerated our food until we received our keys. It was a perfect time for us to explore the beautiful grounds and make our spa appointments. The rooms were impeccable with that "Napa" feel. We don't drink wine so the front desk replaced our complimentary bottles with deliscious "wine country sodas". We stayed up late and enjoyed the coffee and tea in the sitting area on our patios. The next day was all about lounging by the pool. Johnny, our waiter earned every penny of his 18% gratuity. Even after we had finished our wonderful salads and sandwiches (the club was amazing!) he kept the ice water coming all day. The spa treatments were great but could have used the extra 10 min (60 rather than 50). We odered breakfast in bed on Sunday morning and everything was wonderful. All 10 of us ladies had a relaxed and memorable time. Hoping to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort close to downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: daniellehauser
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a girl's trip to Napa Valley and we stayed at the Meritage. It was a beautiful resort with excellent service. Upon check-in, someone brought our bags up to our room. The room had 2 queen beds, fluffy towels, and an elegant bathroom with separate toilet. There was a refrigerator with water and sodas, coffee maker and free bottle of wine. There were free wine tastings both nights we were there, and we even met the owner of the resort. He was a wonderful host and offered great tips on things for us to do in Napa. One of the best ammenities they offer is the free shuttle to downtown Napa which runs 5:30-10:30 pm. The resort is located in an office park about 5 minutes from downtown Napa, so the view isn't fantastic, but it's a great location and wonderful place to stay. We did order room service one morning and eat in the restaurant, and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible memories at The Meritage Resort”
Reviews.Author: SueCali
Reviews.Content: I definitely would recommend staying at The Meritage Resort. It is well worth paying $20 more to have a beautiful view than the standard rooms that have limited views by getting a Superior Room with a view of the vineyards or the pool. From the time that we entered the resort with a cozy elegant lobby and smelled the wood burning in the lobby and watching everyone relaxing with a glass of wine we knew that we were going to have a good time. I typically have to bring my plastic wine glasses, wine and cork screw to a hotel but was pleasantly surprised when there was a bottle of complementary Trinitas Wine waiting for us with wine glasses. That was a very nice touch! There were 2 complimentary bottles of water and two cokes in the refrigerator. It was so nice to have a hotel not charge you $5 for water. I love that it had a refrigerator since we had brought some cheese and fresh fruits to enjoy at our wine tours in the picnic areas. Apparently they had a complimentary reception with drinks around 5pm but we had checked in much later so we opened the bottle, enjoyed our wine, then put on our robe to go to the Jacuzzi. Even though it was raining a little we enjoyed our romantic time in the Jacuzzi that was about 100 F much warmer than typical Jacuzzi’s that are around 80F. The décor was very unique instead of the cheesy picture frames there was a vineyard metal on the wall and the headboard had a vintage look. Everything was very clean and modern looking, the bathrooms, carpets... The only comment I have is that the bathroom door opened in an odd way that is because my father is an architect so I noticed. The complementary hotel shuttle took us to the restaurant that we picked in Yountville and after we were done we called the shuttle and they picked us up which was great because we were all able to drink and not have to worry about driving, parking or finding a cab. We walked up the vineyards the next day which was pretty cool as not too many places allow you to just wander around. We took some awesome pictures. It was cool to enter into a cave for some wine tasting knowing that the vineyards were above us. We took advantage of our 2 for 1 special on the hotel keys and tasted some great wines. We even played a game of bocce ball which was cool. We did not manage to enjoy the huge fire pit area as it was raining the night that we came. We thoroughly enjoyed our Sunday Brunch to our surprise it only cost $21 and included 2 eggs any style and our jus, tea, coffee and hot milk. The was plenty of fresh fruits, eggs benedict, French toast, different prosciutto and cold cuts, salmon, deserts and their croissants must have been from a real French Bakery. Everyone at the hotel accommodated all our needs to make sure that we were going to have an unforgettable time from the receptionists, concierge, room service, and restaurant. We asked for champagne glasses and they brought it for us. Self Parking was free which was great. All the wineries are quite some distant apart that is just the way Napa is laid out due to the wineries and the hilly locations to be able to grow the optimal grapes. I would rate the hotel as 5 stars for location, hospitality, cleanliness, value, service, facility, views and fabulous rooms. I can understand if you select a room with limited or no view facing the parking lot if you pay the minimum but that is the case with any hotel anywhere in the world. But as a guest at the hotel you can still enjoy the great view by walking the grounds and using the facility. I was there with my girlfriend and my sister who just got engaged she had a separate room with her fiancé with a balcony room facing the pool. Absolutely breathtaking! I typically visit Napa once a year but will definitely go back the much sooner than that to enjoy the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a romantic get-away to Napa...this is NOT the place!!!”
Reviews.Author: behappy8284
Reviews.Content: When looking at The Meritage Resort & Spa website, you'll see what "appears" to be a romantic place to get away. A lovely resort & spa that "appears" to be nestled in the valley, surrounded by a peaceful vineyard. Rooms with beautiful views of the vineyard, people relaxing by a luxurious pool, and sipping wine while playing Bocce Ball. Well don't let that fool you, the Meritage is nothing of the sort! Those pictures were taken at cleverly placed angles to make you "think" you're looking at a spectacular place to get away. The truth...It is nestled not in a valley, but in a business park! There is a "small" vineyard on the back hillside, but above that is a highway, and to the side of the resort is another highway. On the entrance side, your view is of the business park and powerlines! Upon entering our room, the first thing I noticed was the worn carpet. Beyond that was a basic room...nothing that made you feel "special". The complimentary bottle of wine that came with the room was simply placed on the counter next to the coffee maker and ice bucket with a presentation that was no different than a complimentary bottle of water. As I proceeded to the window to see our "view", my heart sank. Our "view" was the end of the parking lot. Beyond that was an ugly, fenced construction site, complete with a green fence, bright yellow temporary power poles, a dirt lot, heavy equipment, and a new building under construction. Beyond that was the business park, and several large satellite dishes. If we craned our necks to the left, we could see the end of the vineyard, and the cars passing on the highway above. In conclusion, if you want a quick place to stay en-route, or a quick place to stop with the kids, this would be fine. But if you are looking for a romantic wine country experience...don't bother! We cancelled our reservations and fortunately found lodging elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it.”
Reviews.Author: MardiGrasMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed the comfortable room. Our balcony overlooked the pool with a view of the vineyard too. We both loved our massages at the spa. The wine tasting in the cave was fun and informative. We used the free shuttle everynight and were dropped at the door of fabulous restaurants. The concierge helped us to arrange a driver for a winery tour which turned out to be a wonderful day. The staff was really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeBetty
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this resort. Do to a family medical situation, I had to cancel my reservation. I did so more than 30-days in advance and recorded the cancellation number. Meritage billed my credit card for more than $400 and will not refund my money or return my calls. I travel to Napa twice yearly and was looking forward to a relaxing weekend at Meritage. Although I had to delay my trip, my intent was to reschedule with Meritage. After this experience, my friends and I have decided to return to the SIlverado Resort instead.

Reviews.Title: “The Napa experience exempified!!”
Reviews.Author: DebiAdams
Reviews.Content: If you are dreaming of a wine country experience, this is the place for you!! The hotel has a beautiful vineyard and wine cave with a full service spa. The concierge service was superb! The shuttle service was friendly and timely. The hotel houses a wonderful restaurant, Siena and is close to many exquisite restaurants, including Morimotos, Tyler Florence's, "Rotisserie and Wine", Redd, The French Laundry. We will definetely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is just OK”
Reviews.Author: dsl1955
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 2 nights. The hotel itself is fine but has no atmosphere. It is poorly located in a light industrial park next to Day Laboratories. The hotel is also linked to a vacation share club and sits next to the time share units. The price was fair and the rooms are nice and clean, but if you want to get the feel of the wine country, this is not a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “European Elegance with amazing hospitality..”
Reviews.Author: hyyield63
Reviews.Content: Our stay was "kick-started" by Elisse W's amazing service to get our accommodations tailored to our need. She even arranged for the arrival of our luggage in advance through UPS so that it was there waiting for us at the front desk! We were greeted by Tony, our bellman, who was fantastic and friendly. When we got to the front desk, our names were proudly displayed in a frame, congratulating us on our recent marriage..and to our surprise, Tony handed us a freshly printed copy as a keepsake before we thought to request it! WOW! We were welcomes further by a bottle of their own vineyard's Trinitas Merlot to enjoy, compliments of the resort. After ordering the homemade pizza, we got a call from Room Service asking about the food quality and could they do anything to enhance our stay further! Another wow! Amazing service from day one! Next, we coordinated the majority of our trips through Rosemary, who was as sweet as she was efficient! She actually got us a couples massage at Spa Terra even though we understood them to be booked out the day we wanted to visit! She saved us a great deal in expenses, ensuring we got the best rates on everything from drivers, cabs, and even car rental. She was truly a connected gal with lots of great insight on the area. She was a blessing for us to work with. Jessica at Spa Terra was also accommodating, as it was her help that landed us at Spa Terra for our special spa day. We can't say enough about the staff, the accommodations, the people here, and Michael the GM, whom we bumped into in the Tasting Room at the resort. From Tony to Michael, from Chloe to Elisse, everyone was so wonderful and really bent over backwards to take care of our every wish! We WILL be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Swo_2000
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Meritage. It is a nice place. I drove up into what at first appeared to be a buisiness park.....Then I saw the Meritage. The workers were friendly, very nice rooms, flat screen TV's nice huge bathroom with a large/nice vanity. What really struck me were all the grapevines in the back. Beautiful....They have a swimming pool and benches where one can sit among all the grape vines. There was some construction going on in the back. In the morning it was very peaceful walking about. I ate breakfast there which was good as well. I would say it is about 15 minutes from the Silverado Trail where all the wineries are located. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCarter58
Reviews.Content: We have been here a few times as we come to the Napa Valley several times a year. We decided to stay here for the first time a year ago and then again last week, and each time enjoyed the beautiful amenities and mostly friendly staff. It's a bit out of the way if your expecting to be around the winery scene but it's a nice property in of it self.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews- We had a great stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cabofoodie62
Reviews.Content: I read the Trip Advisor reviews after booking our room, so I was apprehensive about what we were getting into. I had also called ahead to request a room with a pool view, which was cheerfully accomodated when we checked in. The digs about the location are unfounded- it's literally about 3 minutes into Napa from the hotel. The concerns about distance to wineries would be the same for any hotel in Napa- maybe written by someone unfamiliar with the area? THe rooms were nice and impeccably clean. What makes this a great place to stay is the staff- every single person we dealt with ( bar, room service, concierge, restaurant ...) went above and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. In terms of pricing and value, we were able to get a great room rate through Priceline. It's worth noting that the hotel website points out that they will honor any online pricing, so there's really no reason to pay the rack rate. We would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: banjomom_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Meritage for a business meeting. The staff was very professional and helpful. The room was clean and roomy. They is construction going on next door and our room was facing the construction but we weren't bothered by the noise and I found it fascinating to watch the process. My husband left his cell phone and they mailed it back to us promptly. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilesaspen
Reviews.Content: Last time we visited Napa we stayed at the Carneros Inn and thought we should try a new resort this time. Big mistake! Meritage Resort is just an average hotel that definitely falls short of the room rate we paid. There is nothing special about this resort to make me want to pay all the little non-sense resort fees. With an $400 stay on a saturday night, our room view was of the back the utility shed! The restaurant, Siena, was just an average cafeteria-style restaurant, which is surprising when you're surrounded by great food and wine. The Spa experience was nice which was the saving grace of our stay. But the various 'fees' are constantly in your face -- everywhere you look you'll see the so and so fee 'not included.' Overall, if you're paying $150-200, its ok. But when they charge $350-400 a night, I'd expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Hotel ...An Uninspired Stay and Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jamesthewineguy
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the hotel on several levels. My room's furnishing was a bit frumpy and needs a relevant and more modern design. I expected luxuriant linens and thought they were just average. I expected the toiletry to be evocative and a higher line. The television selection was very limited. The outdoor fire pit closes unusually early and be sure to bring your plastic cups because of it's proximity to the swimming pool. The pit was terribly uncomfortable--it could have felt a bit more outdoorsy. I had a good view of the on-premise vineyard. Overall I was disappointed in the hotel. A successful experience is layered with so many fine points and attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Food Poisoning and Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: info75039
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and ate dinner in their "Siena Restaurant" and got food poisoning! The staff was not helpful, comforting even when it was obvious we were violently ill. They were very indignant including stating that they had never gotten below an A grade from Health Inspector! After filing complaint with Health Department it was divulged that Siena has in fact gotten low grades for their food service so, obviously, there have been problems previously!! On our trip home we met previous guests who also had gotten food poisoning from eating at this hotel!
